thread.title_full: IGP: Jong-nam attackers knew substance was toxic - Nation | The Star Online

author: Farik Zolkepliandjastin Ahmad Tarmizi
title: IGP: Jong-nam attackers knew substance was toxic - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Wednesday, 22 February 2017 | MYT 11:40 AM IGP: Jong-nam attackers knew substance was toxic by farik zolkepli and jastin ahmad tarmizi 
KUALA LUMPUR: The two women detained in connection with the assassination of North Korean leader Kim Jong-unâ€™s half-brother Kim Jong-nam knew the substance they used in the attack was toxic. 
Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Khalid Abu Bakar said police also believe that the women - Doan Thi Huong and Siti Aisyah - were instructed to wash their hands after the attack on Feb 13. 
"We are ruling out the possibility that the women thought the attack was a prank or even that they believed they were shooting a television show. 
"We expect their remand to be extended today for seven more days," he told a press conference on Wednesday.
